intro: Aeschynomene recta, commonly known as slenderleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Aeschynomene recta is also known for its potential use in forage and soil stabilization due to its hardy nature.
